titles: Australia news live: deputy Nationals leader backs net zero and Littleproud as leader; interstate emergency teams help assess NSW floods damage
summary: Kevin Hogan, in a recent statement, defended his decision to sever ties with the Liberal Party, describing it as a 'principled' choice. He clarified that the request for the Nationals to break cabinet solidarity was not discussed in the party room as it was not deemed a non-negotiable issue. Despite differing views, Hogan highlighted positive feedback from his community, appreciating the stand for regional policies. This move comes amidst discussions on coalition dynamics and policy priorities.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful insights into the dynamics of the political landscape in Australia, specifically the Nationals party.
